skillTree.localised_description: Command Volker to mobilise the Cult. Our agents will sabotage rivals and strengthen our recruitment efforts. Change is coming…

effects.description: Cults will be established at: Nuln, Wurtbad, Marienburg & Talabheim

skillTree.localised_description: Command Proll, Zuntermein, & Lieberung to mobilise the Cult. Our agents will reach out to the neighbouring Tzeentchian cults and coordinate the Empire’s downfall as one.

effects.description: Cults will be established at: Middenheim, Salzenmund, Hochland & Bechafen

skillTree.localised_description: Your Nehekhran puppet, Sadikur, has slumbered long enough. Awaken your ancient servant and have him spread your influence in the lifeless deserts. Ptra will not be able to save his damned kingdom again.

effects.description: Cults will be established at: Khemri, Numas & El-Kalabad

skillTree.localised_description: Binding accords that force even the mindless brutes of Khorne to cooperate with us.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca (Except Nurgle)
Allegiance points gained: +30% for alliances with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
Diplomatic relations: +40 with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca (Except Nurgle)
Allegiance points gained: +60% for alliances with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Reach into the unknown and bring forth the embodiment of change and magic.
Sheerargetru understands the value of books, scrolls and trinkets, if not for his own enrichment, then to uplift his subordinates.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cooldown: -1 turns
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -2 turns

skillTree.localised_description: Many Northmen already revere the Eagle and his followers, so controlling these savages will be child’s play.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Maruders of Tzeentch & Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Maruders of Tzeentch & Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Maruders of Tzeentch & Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +16% for Maruders of Tzeentch & Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Few rival Sheerargetru in his ancient wisdom and knowledge. His schemes are complex and subtle, but when they succeed, their effects are destructive and far-reaching.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

Recruit rank: +4 for Lord of Change units
	(all armies factionwide)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15

skillTree.localised_description: Infiltrate dreams and send visions of death over and over, until their minds break!

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Witness He who weaves threads. Witness He who brings turmoil. Witness He who corrupts. Witness me, the true lord of the Broken Wheel!

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +25
	(Lord's army)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Cultists
	(local province)

Unit experience gain per turn: +50
	(Lord's army)

Hero recruit rank: +3 for Cultists
	(local province)

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Cultist of Tzeentch
	(local province)

Unit experience gain per turn: +66
	(Lord's army)

Hero recruit rank: +4 for Cultists
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Sheerargetru has haunted the Empire since the days of old. His eyes are set on one prize, the weapon that was used by Sigmar Heldenhammer to banish & imprison him centuries ago: Ghal Maraz.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% when fighting against the Empire
	(all armies factionwide)

Experience gain: +30% when fighting against the Empire
	(all armies factionwide)
Post battle income: +25% when fighting against the Empire
Passive ability: "Frenzy" when fighting against Empire

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Empire
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Be it slaves or trinkets, Tzeentch cares not what is offered as long as you show reverence.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Flamers, Exalted Flamers, Changebringers, Soul Grinder & Lord of Change units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +9 for Flamers, Exalted Flamers, Changebringers, Soul Grinder & Lord of Change units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The desperate masses of the world cling to notions of safety and hope. We will exploit these naïve delusions and make them bend the knee to Chaos!

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Mortal followers of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +4 for Mortal followers of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “The threads that I have woven are only a fraction of the grand tapestry that He has set in motion.”

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Mortal followers of Tzeentch
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “Cease your squirming! There is no escape for you now.”

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +15% after winning a battle

Campaign movement range: -15% for enemy armies starting their turn in this region
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: “Yes… adorn my feathers with baubles! Fill my coffers with treasure!”

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +9%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +18%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +27%

skillTree.localised_description: “Whether they be low-born farmers or wealthy nobles, they all have a part to play in my plans… whether they know it or not.”

Reload time reduction: +15% for Flamers, Exalted Flamers & Changebringers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “With the Changer’s blessings, I shall change this world to His image. The time of Sheerargetru is here…”

effects.description:
Range: +20% for Flamers, Exalted Flamers & Changebringers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +8% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although it can be said that they have failed His tests, the broken minds and fluctuating, mutated bodies of Tzeeneth's lesser minions still have their uses.

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe – the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

skillTree.localised_description: The thundering of their Chaos Steeds and chariots announces the arrival of Kaldour's dread Knights, and death is never far behind them.

Weapon strength: +8% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: For the Winged Watchers and Doomstriders of this world, their very lack of identifiable corporeal form shall be their armour against attack.

Armour: +6 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

Leadership: +6 for Marauders, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Warshrines, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Of the many weapons available to Tchar, derangement must surely be the greatest and most satsifying to wield.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change, Soul Grinder units, Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

Leadership: +6 for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
As they are a most adept and dedicated magic-user, where this one treads, the Winds always blow high and hard.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +5%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +5%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +10%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +15%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +15%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeeneth are fed and nourished.
The many faces of the Wind-lord are described here, along with all the terrible mysteries of destiny. Between these lines lurks insanity, ever waiting to trap the unwary.
Tzeentch knows that at their cores all beings desire Change, and as such there are no shortage of recruits willing to march under his many-coloured banner.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

effects.description: Sheerargetru will be given dilemmas & events to bring about the Great Turmoil of the Empire
Cult buildings & Outpost have additional effects

items.colour_text: Golden and ornate with a shimmering eye at its centre facing the skies, this helm allows its wearer to observe the battlefield as if he were the Changer himself. Nothing will escape the gaze of Sheerargetru while this helmet sits atop his feathered head.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Metal spells

target_if: Not on or below a platform

items.colour_text: At a glance, this weapon may seem rather ordinary for a Lord of Change; in reality, however, the staff is imbued with powerful enchantments that cause the Winds of Magic to surge, distorting time itself.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

items.colour_text: An amulet made of pure gold and silver that belonged to a forgotten king centuries ago dangles around Sheerargetru’s neck; a trophy from a past scheme.

effects.description: Attribute: Mastery of Elemental Winds for Sheerargetru

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Threads are woven wherever Sheerargetru goes; a magnificent tapestry of lies, confusion and chaos can topple empires.
